title: Pork Laab
source: Lemongrass and Lime (Pig & Khao) - Leah Cohen
categories: Lemongrass and Lime (Pig & Khao) - Leah Cohen
ingredients: Freshly squeezed juice of 8 limes (about 1 cup)
2teaspoons Thai chili flakes (or more if you like spicy)
1tablespoon granulated sugar (if the limes are very tart, add more sugar to balance)
1large scallion (white parts and green parts), thinly sliced
directions: 1. Bring 1 cup of water to a boil in a large high-sided sauté pan. Add the pork and cook, stirring and breaking it up with a wooden spoon, for about 5 minutes, until it is just cooked through and no pink remains. Transfer to a colander and drain well.
2. Whisk together the lime juice, fish sauce, chili flakes, sugar, and shallot in a large bowl.
3. Transfer the pork to the bowl and mix well to combine. Stir in ¼ cup of the rice powder.
4. Transfer to a serving bowl and stir in the scallion, cilantro, and mint. Garnish with the crispy garlic and the remaining 1 tablespoon rice powder.
